node.name: Properties Editor
node.shortdescription:
It is released from the troublesomeness of the Unicode conversion by native2ascii.

Development using the properties file is performed by Java by the setting file of J2EE application, internationalization correspondence with desktop application, etc. being sufficient. However, you have to change the multi-byte character in a file into Unicode with the native2ascii tool of attachment in J2SDK o?n the character platform un-depending.
This editor can edit directly the property file written in the Unicode reference character, and saves the time and effort changed into Unicode by native2ascii. In addition to the usual functions of an editor, the plugin is integrated with Eclipse, it is possible to open the properties file in a project directly and to edit it, and, of course, it is saved by Unicode. It can use by intuitive and simple operation.



Latest version for Eclipse3.2 or later:5.3.3
node.body:
It is released from the troublesomeness of the Unicode conversion by native2ascii.

Development using the properties file is performed by Java by the setting file of J2EE application, internationalization correspondence with desktop application, etc. being sufficient. However, you have to change the multi-byte character in a file into Unicode with the native2ascii tool of attachment in J2SDK o?n the character platform un-depending.
This editor can edit directly the property file written in the Unicode reference character, and saves the time and effort changed into Unicode by native2ascii. In addition to the usual functions of an editor, the plugin is integrated with Eclipse, it is possible to open the properties file in a project directly and to edit it, and, of course, it is saved by Unicode. It can use by intuitive and simple operation.



Latest version for Eclipse3.2 or later:5.3.3
